metadata.title: Tuesday, 2nd December, 2014
metadata.session: FOURTH SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)    what progress has been made on the redesignation of the 1958 chiefdom boundaries;
(b)    what obstacles, if any, are hindering the redesignation of the chiefdom boundaries; and
(c)    when a new map for chiefdom boundaries will be issued.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of King Lewanika University in Western Province will commence;
(b)    whether a contractor has already been identified and, if so, what the name of the contractor is;
(c)    what the estimated cost of the project is; and
(d)    what the time-frame for the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Chiefs and Traditional Affairs
parts: (a)    what types of Museums Zambia has;
(b)    what role the Government is playing in the establishment of the Mining Museum in Kabwe District;
(c)    whether the Government is considering retrieving the skull of Broken Hill Man from the British Government upon the establishment of the Mining Museum; and
(d)    what the estimated cost of establishing the Museum is.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands, Natural Resources and Environmental Protection
parts: (a)    what measures the Government has taken to protect forest reserves from encroachment in Kapiri Mposhi District;
(b)    when the Kapiri Mposhi District Forest Office will be renovated and provided with transport; and

(c)    when the bee-keeping programme and other initiatives aimed at reducing dependence on charcoal burning will be implemented. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    Estimates of Revenue and Expenditure (Including Capital and Constitutional and Statutory Expenditure) : Committee of Supply: Resumption of Debate:(Head 78/01: under consideration):(Mr Miyutu). Heads 89/01, 89/02, 89/03, 89/04, 89/05, 89/06, 89/07, 89/08, 89/09, 89/10, 89/11, 89/12, 89/13, 89/14, 89/15, 89/16, 89/17, 89/18, 89/19, 89/20, 89/21, 89/22, 89/23, 89/24, 89/25, 89/26, 89/27, 89/28, 89/29, 89/30, 89/31, 89/32, 89/33, 89/34, 89/36, 89/37, 76/01, 76/02, 76/03 and 87/01 - for consideration.
